Key Match Events: Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres and Game 3 star Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees
Aaron Judge secured the final out for New York
Michael Wacha failed to get through five innings for Kansas City, allowing two runs, six hits and a walk
Gerrit Cole pitched like a postseason ace, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings
Clay Holmes tossed a perfect eighth inning and Luke Weaver breezed through the ninth
Volpe slapped a hard tag on Maikel Garcia at second base to complete a double play, leading to a near-fracas between players
Pre-Game Insights: New York Yankees' manager Aaron Boone said, 'Proud of these guys. We get to go play for it now and we're excited about that.'

Aaron Judge said, 'Feel really badly for those guys in the room, because as you know, this is seven, eight months of the year that they just pour it all into it, and give every ounce of effort and energy they have.'
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees third baseman Jazz Chisholm Jr. said, 'I just felt like (Garcia) tried to go in and injure Volpe because he was being a sore loser, I told him that we don't do that on this side, and I'm going to stick up for my guys.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: New York Yankees will play Cleveland or Detroit of the ALCS starting Monday night at Yankee Stadium.
The game was played at Kauffman Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri.
